body:
I've been banging my head against the wall for hours over this with no progress so need some help. I cannot decipher 

$ ./spack install xsdk@0.1.0
==> Error: Invalid spec: 'trilinos@12.8.1%gcc@6.2.0+boost~debug+hdf5+hypre+metis+mumps~python+shared+suite-sparse+superlu-dist~xsdkflags arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64^boost^cmake@2.8.12%gcc@6.2.0~doc+ncurses+openssl~ownlibs~qt arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64^curl@7.50.3%gcc@6.2.0 arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64^glm@0.9.7.1%gcc@6.2.0 arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64^hdf5@1.10.0-patch1%gcc@6.2.0+cxx~debug+fortran+mpi+shared~szip~threadsafe arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64^hypre@2.11.1%gcc@6.2.0~internal-superlu~shared arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64^libsigsegv^m4@1.4.17%gcc@6.2.0+sigsegv arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64^matio@1.5.2%gcc@6.2.0 arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64^metis@5.1.0%gcc@6.2.0~debug~gdb~idx64~real64+shared arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64^mpich@3.2%gcc@6.2.0+hydra+pmi+romio~verbs arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64^mumps@5.0:+mpi+shared^netcdf@4.4.1%gcc@6.2.0~hdf4 maxdims=1024 maxvars=8192+mpi arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64^openblas@0.2.19%gcc@6.2.0+fpic~openmp+shared arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64^openssl@1.0.2j%gcc@6.2.0 arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64^parmetis@4.0.3%gcc@6.2.0~debug~gdb+shared arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64^scalapack^suite-sparse^superlu-dist@5.0.0%gcc@6.2.0 arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64^zlib@1.2.8%gcc@6.2.0 arch=darwin-sierra-x86_64'. Package trilinos requires version 12.6.2, but spec asked for 12.8.1

This is from my BarrySmith fork in the branch barry/develop

"but spec asked for 12.8.1" Well, but what spec? Could this message be more informative by indicating exactly what is requesting each version? You need more complete error messages so even and idiot like my can determine what I have done wrong. Terse error messages make users very frustrated.

As far as I know I've tried to require that Trilinos not use mumps and suite-sparse in xsdk so I am totally mystified why + for them appears in that "Invalid spec", where is that coming from?
title: understanding spack messages about invalid spec
